message: One day on Venus is longer than a year! It takes 243 Earth days to rotate once and 225 days to orbit the Sun.
Jupiter has the shortest day of all the planets. It completes a rotation on its axis in about 10 hours.
The hottest planet is Venus, with an average surface temperature of about 462°C (864°F).
Mars is home to the tallest mountain in the solar system, Olympus Mons, at about 13.6 miles high.
The Milky Way will collide with the Andromeda galaxy in about 4.5 billion years.
Neutron stars are so dense that a sugar-cube-sized amount would weigh about a billion tons.
Olympus Mons on Mars is the largest volcano in the solar system, nearly three times the height of Everest.
A day on Pluto is about 6.4 Earth days long.
Space is silent because there is no atmosphere to carry sound waves.
The moon drifts away from Earth at a rate of about 1.5 inches per year.
There are more trees on Earth (over 3 trillion) than stars in the Milky Way (100-400 billion).
Saturn's rings are mostly made of ice particles, rocky debris, and dust.
It rains diamonds on Jupiter and Saturn due to high pressure and heat turning carbon into diamonds.
The Sun's core is about 27 million degrees Fahrenheit (15 million degrees Celsius).
A year on Neptune lasts about 165 Earth years.
Pluto has mountains made of ice that are as tall as the Rockies.
